t: Luke 20
Jesus’ Authority Questioned
On*p one of the days while He was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes with the elders confronted Him,*i
and they spoke, saying to Him, “Tell us by what authority You are doing these things, or who is the one who gave You this authority?”
Jesus answered and said to them, “I*r will*r also*r ask*r you*r a*r question,*r and*r you*r tell*r Me:*r
Was*r the*r baptism*r of*r John*r from*r heaven*r or*r from*r men?”*r
They reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’
But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us to death, for they are convinced that John was a prophet.”
So they answered that they did not know where it*i came*i from.
And Jesus said to them, “Nor*r will*r I*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.”*r
Parable of the Vine-growers
And*p He began to tell the people this parable: “A*r man*r planted*r a*r vineyard*r and*r rented*r it*r out*r to*r vine-growers,*r and*r went*r on*r a*r journey*r for*r a*r long*r time.*r

At*r the*r harvest*ir time*r he*r sent*r a*r slave*r to*r the*r vine-growers,*r so*r that*r they*r would*r give*r him*r some*ir of*r the*r produce*r of*r the*r vineyard;*r but*r the*r vine-growers*r beat*r him*r and*r sent*r him*r away*r empty-handed.*r
And*r he*r proceeded*r to*r send*r another*r slave;*r and*r they*r beat*r him*r also*r and*r treated*r him*r shamefully*r and*r sent*r him*r away*r empty-handed.*r
And*r he*r proceeded*r to*r send*r a*r third;*r and*r this*r one*r also*r they*r wounded*r and*r cast*r out.*r
The*r owner*r of*r the*r vineyard*r said,*r ‘What*r shall*r I*r do?*r I*r will*r send*r my*r beloved*r son;*r perhaps*r they*r will*r respect*r him.’*r

But*r when*r the*r vine-growers*r saw*r him,*r they*r reasoned*r with*r one*r another,*r saying,*r ‘This*r is*r the*r heir;*r let*r us*r kill*r him*r so*r that*r the*r inheritance*r will*r be*r ours.’*r
So*r they*r threw*r him*r out*r of*r the*r vineyard*r and*r killed*r him.*r What,*r then,*r will*r the*r owner*r of*r the*r vineyard*r do*r to*r them?*r
He*r will*r come*r and*r destroy*r these*r vine-growers*r and*r will*r give*r the*r vineyard*r to*r others.”*r When they heard it, they said, “May it never be!”

But Jesus looked at them and said, “What*r then*r is*r this*r that*r is*r written:*r ‘The*srpn stone*sr which*sr the*sr builders*sr rejected,*sr This*srln became*sr the*sr chief*sr corner*sr stone’?*ir
Everyone*rp who*r falls*r on*r that*r stone*r will*r be*r broken*r to*r pieces;*r but*r on*r whomever*r it*r falls,*r it*r will*r scatter*r him*r like*r dust.”*r
Tribute to Caesar
The*p scribes and the chief priests tried to lay hands on Him that very hour, and they feared the people; for they understood that He spoke this parable against them.

So they watched Him, and sent spies who pretended to be righteous, in order that they might catch Him in some statement, so that they could*i deliver Him to the rule and the authority of the governor.
They questioned Him, saying, “Teacher, we know that You speak and teach correctly, and You are not partial to any, but teach the way of God in truth.
Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
But He detected their trickery and said to them,
“Show*r Me*r a*r denarius.*r Whose*r likeness*r and*r inscription*r does*r it*r have?”*r They said, “Caesar’s.”
And He said to them, “Then*r render*r to*r Caesar*r the*r things*r that*r are*r Caesar’s,*r and*r to*r God*r the*r things*r that*r are*r God’s.”*r
And they were unable to catch Him in a saying in the presence of the people; and being amazed at His answer, they became silent.
Is There a Resurrection?
Now*p there came to Him some of the Sadducees (who say that there is no resurrection),

and they questioned Him, saying, “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if*s a*s man’s*s brother*s dies,*s having a wife, and*s he*s is*s childless,*s his*s brother*s should*s marry*s the*s wife*s and*s raise*s up*s children*s to*s his*s brother.*s
Now there were seven brothers; and the first took a wife and died childless;
and the second
and the third married her; and in the same way all seven died, leaving no children.
Finally the woman died also.
In the resurrection therefore, which one’s wife will she be? For all seven had married her.”
Jesus*p said to them, “The*r sons*r of*r this*r age*r marry*r and*r are*r given*r in*r marriage,*r
but*r those*r who*r are*r considered*r worthy*r to*r attain*r to*r that*r age*r and*r the*r resurrection*r from*r the*r dead,*r neither*r marry*r nor*r are*r given*r in*r marriage;*r
for*r they*r cannot*r even*r die*r anymore,*r because*r they*r are*r like*r angels,*r and*r are*r sons*r of*r God,*r being*r sons*r of*r the*r resurrection.*r

But*r that*r the*r dead*r are*r raised,*r even*r Moses*r showed,*r in*r the*r passage*ir about*ir the*ir burning*ir bush,*r where*r he*r calls*r the*r Lord*r the*sr God*sr of*sr Abraham,*r and*sr the*sr God*sr of*sr Isaac,*r and*sr the*sr God*sr of*sr Jacob.*sr
Now*r He*r is*r not*r the*r God*r of*r the*r dead*r but*r of*r the*r living;*r for*r all*r live*r to*r Him.”*r
Some of the scribes answered and said, “Teacher, You have spoken well.”
For they did not have courage to question Him any longer about anything.
Then*p He said to them, “How*r is*ir it*ir that*ir they*r say*r the*r Christ*r is*r David’s*r son?*r
For*r David*r himself*r says*r in*r the*r book*r of*r Psalms,*r ‘The*srpn Lord*sr said*sr to*sr my*sr Lord,*sr “Sit*srln at*sr My*sr right*sr hand,*sr
Until*srln I*r make*sr Your*sr enemies*sr a*sr footstool*sr for*sr Your*sr feet*sr .” ’*r
Therefore*rp David*r calls*r Him*r ‘Lord,’*r and*r how*r is*r He*r his*r son?”*r
And*p while all the people were listening, He said to the disciples,

“Beware*r of*r the*r scribes,*r who*r like*r to*r walk*r around*r in*r long*r robes,*r and*r love*r respectful*r greetings*r in*r the*r market*r places,*r and*r chief*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues*r and*r places*r of*r honor*r at*r banquets,*r
who*r devour*r widows’*r houses,*r and*r for*r appearance’s*r sake*r offer*r long*r prayers.*r These*r will*r receive*r greater*r condemnation.”*r
